creator: cpile@snoogans.co.uk
text:
1) The mod_ldap documentation - example configurations - refer to using "AuthLDAPEnabled", but it does not seem this exists in httpd-2.2. I see that "AuthLDAPAuthzEnabled" is mentioned (but commented out) in mod_authnz_ldap.c. 2) In the example configurations, the reference to "AuthLDAPAuthoritative" should be changed to "AuthzLDAPAuthoritative" for httpd-2.2. 3) Since the example configurations use "require valid-user", should "AuthzLDAPAuthoritative on" actually be "AuthzLDAPAuthoritative off" as suggested from the mod_authnz_ldap documentation (http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mod_authnz_ldap.html#reqvaliduser): " require valid-user If this directive exists, mod_authnz_ldap grants access to any user that has successfully authenticated during the search/bind phase. Requires that mod_authz_user be loaded and that the AuthzLDAPAuthoritative directive be set to off. " 4) "LDAPConnectionTimeout Directive" does not contain a Default value in the overview box, yet the accompanying text states that the default is 10 seconds. Thanks, Chris. e.g. $ diff -Nurd mod_ldap.html.en.orig mod_ldap.html.en --- mod_ldap.html.en.orig Sun Nov 13 06:38:36 2005 +++ mod_ldap.html.en Sat Dec 24 10:36:18 2005 @@ -102,9 +102,8 @@ Order deny,allow
Deny from all
Allow from yourdomain.example.com
- AuthLDAPEnabled on
AuthLDAPURL ldap://127.0.0.1/dc=example,dc=com?uid?one
- AuthLDAPAuthoritative on
+ AuthzLDAPAuthoritative off
require valid-user
</Location> @@ -231,9 +230,8 @@ Order deny,allow
Deny from all
Allow from yourdomain.example.com
- AuthLDAPEnabled on
AuthLDAPURL ldaps://127.0.0.1/dc=example,dc=com?uid?one
- AuthLDAPAuthoritative on
+ AuthzLDAPAuthoritative off
require valid-user
</Location> @@ -252,10 +250,9 @@ Order deny,allow
Deny from all
Allow from yourdomain.example.com
- AuthLDAPEnabled on
LDAPTrustedMode TLS AuthLDAPURL ldap://127.0.0.1/dc=example,dc=com?uid?one
- AuthLDAPAuthoritative on
+ AuthzLDAPAuthoritative off
require valid-user
</Location> @@ -305,10 +302,9 @@ Order deny,allow
Deny from all
Allow from yourdomain.example.com
- AuthLDAPEnabled on
LDAPTrustedClientCert CERT_NICKNAME <nickname> [password]
AuthLDAPURL ldaps://127.0.0.1/dc=example,dc=com?uid?one
- AuthLDAPAuthoritative on
+ AuthzLDAPAuthoritative off
require valid-user
</Location> @@ -372,11 +368,10 @@ Order deny,allow
Deny from all
Allow from yourdomain.example.com
- AuthLDAPEnabled on
LDAPTrustedClientCert CERT_BASE64 /certs/cert1.pem
LDAPTrustedClientCert KEY_BASE64 /certs/key1.pem
AuthLDAPURL ldaps://127.0.0.1/dc=example,dc=com?uid?one
- AuthLDAPAuthoritative on
+ AuthzLDAPAuthoritative off
require valid-user
</Location> @@ -443,6 +438,7 @@ + @@ -630,4 +626,4 @@

- \ No newline at end of file +
Description:Specifies the socket connection timeout in seconds
Syntax:LDAPConnectionTimeout seconds
Default:LDAPConnectionTimeout 10
Context:server config
Status:Extension
Module:mod_ldap

Regarding point 3) below, I believe the correct ldap-status Location
configuration should look something like:

<Location /ldap-status>
SetHandler ldap-status
AuthBasicProvider ldap
AuthType Basic
AuthName "Password protected area"
Order deny,allow
Deny from all
Allow from yourdomain.example.com
AuthLDAPURL ldap://127.0.0.1/dc=example,dc=com?uid?one
AuthLDAPAuthoritative off
require valid-user
</Location>

Thanks,
Chris.
creator: cpile@snoogans.co.uk
stella@rider.edu
text:
The correct ldap-status should use

AuthzLDAPAuthoritative off

(add 'z')

creator: cpile@snoogans.co.uk
text:
R.Stella, indeed you are correct it should be AuthzLDAPAuthoritative with the
"z".  I used this in my first post but forgot the "z" in my second post.  Thanks
for pointing that out.

Chris.

text:
wrowe@apache.org wrote
Of course, compiling for openssl remains someone complex as one must
manage to build openssl first, of course.
---------------------------------------------------------------
This is ok but there needs to be a bit more discussion about what to do after
you get openssl built so that you have the bits and pieces in the right spots.
It also looks like some of the files are corrupted in the build with VC 6.

I am far from an expert in these matters but perhaps Openssl needs to be built
outside of scrlib and only some of the bits and pieces that HTTPD needs should
be copied to somewhere that they can be found in the HTTPD build.
